title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
description:
Bug 38131ajc needs -d option. I am using version 1.1rc1. This is a regression since rc1 and a deviation from javac. I am guessing this may have something to do with a change in the underlying Eclipse compiler.

To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a class in a subpackage:
   - Package: subpackage
   - Class: Test
   - Code:
     ```
     package subpackage;

     public class Test {
         public static void main(String[] args) {
             System.out.println("Hello");
         }
     }
     ```

2. Compile the class using the following command:
   - Command: ajc subpackage\Test.java

Observed Behavior: The test.class file is then put in the subpackage\subpackage directory. This means running the java command results in the exception:
   - Exception: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test

Expected Behavior: Running either of the following commands fixes the problem:
   - ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
   - javac subpackage\Test.java
OB:
The test.class file is then put in the subpackage\subpackage directory. This means running the java command results in the exception:
   - Exception: Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test
EB:
Running either of the following commands fixes the problem:
   - ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
   - javac subpackage\Test.java
SR:
Compile the class using the following command:
   - Command: ajc subpackage\Test.java
